alert.note: Alert for McKean; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN MCKEAN COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Warren, moving east at 15 mph. Other storms were just east of this storm. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Wetmore, Ludlow, Westline, Chapman State Park, Warren South, Tidioute and Clarendon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
